--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> OOC: That was pretty good, and I like long posts. But let me ask 
you, is
> there something wrong with your face?


    OOC: Something wrong with my face? *Looks inncocent* Naaa..I 
always grin like Blindchaos. (Either that or my mask is stuck on 
permanent, for all you Hexadecimal fans of Reboot fame!)



> 
> BIC:
> Beachcomber arrived on the edge of the valley. He quickly 
transformed,
> and turned around. He put his hands out, and a beam emmitted into 
the
> ground. Waves began to spray across his shadelike eyes. "Hmmmmmmmm. 
The
> valley is very dry, lined with igneous rocks, but there is a strange
> energy, that seems out of place." He said, contemplatevly. He began 
to
> walk forwards, towards Redhot.


::Redhot::

    Redhot's mind was in a fog. He drifted in and out of
conscousness, 
always on the verge of Stasis lock. He was faintly aware of someone
or 
something approaching. It could have been one of this world's alien 
lifeforms but in Redhot's state, he didn't know the difference. Nor 
did he care.
    He tried to move his severly injured arm but could not. The pain 
receptors in it had made it as lifeless as he felt. A quiet, 
frustrated cry rose from him. It sounded reminiscent of Starscream. 
    Almost everything about him looked like a Decpticon seeker. He
was 
similar to Skywarp and his brothers, just a clear bright red with
rich 
black fists. The colour looked like it would glow if it wasn't for
his 
injuries. His ensignia, battered and caked with gore, claimed he was 
an Autobot. 


Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
